TITLE: Protesters camp out in Iraq's Parliament building as a power struggle unfolds
SUMMARY: Followers of an influential cleric have pledged to continue the sit-in to derail efforts from Iran-backed groups to form the country's next government.

TITLE: Kentucky's governor warns residents to brace for more flooding
SUMMARY: Kentucky officials are still working to confirm deaths from the past week's flooding. Hundreds of people have already been displaced.

TITLE: Nichelle Nichols, Lt. Uhura on 'Star Trek,' dies at 89
SUMMARY: Nichols broke ground and paved the way for Black actors in Hollywood as Uhura. Her castmate George Takei wrote, "We lived long and prospered together."

TITLE: At the Euro 2022 final, England takes its first major women's soccer title
SUMMARY: England beat Germany 2-1 in the final of the European Championship after extra time. After the final whistle, the England players danced and the crowd sang their anthem "Sweet Caroline."

TITLE: You could get paid to eat candy as a Canadian company's chief candy officer
SUMMARY: Candy Funhouse's chief candy officer will taste test over 3,500 products a month. Applicants can be as young as 5 years old.

TITLE: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson gets her own bobblehead
SUMMARY: The National Bobblehead Hall of Fame and Museum has unveiled its bobblehead of Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson. The bobbleheads are expected to ship in September.

TITLE: A Greenland shark, one of the longest-living animals on Earth, was caught near Belize
SUMMARY: This was the first time a Greenland shark was reported in the western Caribbean, researchers said. This species of shark is typically found in the Arctic and thousands of feet below the ocean surface.

TITLE: Pelosi begins Asia tour in Singapore. No official word on whether she'll visit Taiwan
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi arrived in Singapore early Monday, kicking off her Asian tour as questions swirled over a possible stop in Taiwan that has fueled tension with Beijing.

TITLE: Turkey says the first grain ship set to depart Ukrainian port
SUMMARY: Turkey says the first ship carrying Ukrainian grain under a new agreement among Turkey, Russia, Ukraine and the United Nations will leave the Ukrainian port of Odesa on Monday bound for Lebanon.

TITLE: Australia's Parliament considers lifting euthanasia ban in two territories
SUMMARY: Australia's Northern Territory in 1995 became the first place in the world to legalize voluntary euthanasia, but the law was quickly overturned two years later. The new bill seeks to lift the ban.

TITLE: First ship carrying Ukrainian grain leaves the port of Odesa
SUMMARY: Turkey says the first ship carrying Ukrainian grain under a new agreement among Turkey, Russia, Ukraine and the United Nations left the Ukrainian port of Odesa on Monday bound for Lebanon.

TITLE: As a racial justice activist, NBA great Bill Russell was a legend off the court
SUMMARY: Boston Celtics legend Bill Russell was a civil rights trailblazer, before, during and after his basketball career. He was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2011 for his activism efforts.

TITLE: She voted to impeach Trump. Now Rep. Herrera Beutler tries to navigate a tough primary
SUMMARY: The Washington state congresswoman was one of just 10 House Republicans who voted to impeach Trump after Jan. 6. And she is one of three who are on the ballot Tuesday — in Washington and in Michigan.

TITLE: Alzheimer's researchers are looking beyond plaques and tangles for new treatments
SUMMARY: An atlas showing how Alzheimer's changes individual brain cells could help researchers find new treatments for the disease.

TITLE: This Black-owned coworking space wants to advance and support businesswomen of color
SUMMARY: By channeling its focus on women of color in the workplace, the primary goal for Blackbird Collective is simply to provide its members with a safe space to work and connect.

TITLE: Whether from an antique shop or discount store, toxic lead items are easy to buy
SUMMARY: Lead is regularly found in vintage items more than 40 years old, but also in many new, cheaply made dollar-store goods. Children are especially susceptible to lead-poisoning even at low levels.

TITLE: As Western flames spread, California sees its largest 2022 fire
SUMMARY: Crews battling the largest wildfire so far this year in California braced for thunderstorms and hot, windy conditions that created the potential for additional fire growth Sunday.

TITLE: Pat Carroll, Emmy winner and voice of Ursula, dies at 95
SUMMARY: Carroll was a comedic television mainstay for decades in addition to playing the villain in <em>The Little Mermaid.

TITLE: The first Ukrainian grain ship leaves Odesa after months of Russian blockade
SUMMARY: The milestone comes after the U.N. and Turkey signed agreements with Russia and Ukraine to resume exports. The U.N. had pushed for a deal to address a growing global food shortage.

TITLE: North Carolina certifies the Green Party, which could allow it onto the Senate ballot
SUMMARY: National Democrats have questioned the validity of the Green Party's signatures on a petition drive needed to get a spot on the state ballot.

TITLE: People who want to visit the world's tallest living tree now risk a $5,000 fine
SUMMARY: Hyperion, the world's tallest living tree, has suffered as hikers in California's Redwood National Park damaged its habitat. Now, prospective visitors face a $5,000 fine and six months in jail.

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: A weekly recap and look ahead (Aug. 1)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: What it's like to watch the women's Tour de France, for the only American to win it
SUMMARY: The Tour de France for women fizzled out less than 10 years after Marianne Martin won it in 1984. Now, she says, "other women can see women racing and they can visualize themselves doing it."

TITLE: How white nationalists in Texas terrorized refugees after the Vietnam War
SUMMARY: Kirk Wallace Johnson tells the story of a bitter conflict that arose along the Gulf Coast when Vietnam war refugees began trawling for shrimp in the area. His book is <em>The Fishermen and the Dragon.

TITLE: Deshaun Watson is suspended for 6 games over sexual misconduct
SUMMARY: The NFL confirmed the Browns quarterback is being suspended for violating the league's personal conduct policy following accusations of sexual misconduct made against him by two dozen women in Texas.

TITLE: Critics say 'monkeypox' is a racist name. But it's not going away anytime soon
SUMMARY: Scientists call the name "discriminatory and stigmatizing." The World Health Organization agrees. But no progress has been made on finding a new name. And some say the name doesn't need changing.

TITLE: More rain hits Kentucky while the death toll from flooding grows
SUMMARY: At least 35 have been confirmed killed in flooding and hundreds remain unaccounted for. The governor warned that high winds could create the danger of falling trees and utility poles.

TITLE: We might never know who won the Mega Millions jackpot. That's not usually the case
SUMMARY: Most states do not currently grant anonymity to lottery winners. Some lawmakers have tried to change that in recent years out of growing privacy and safety concerns.

TITLE: The U.S. has killed top al-Qaida leader and key 9/11 plotter, Ayman al-Zawahiri
SUMMARY: A senior military official has confirmed with NPR that a strike carried out by the U.S. has killed Ayman al-Zawahiri, a top Al-Qaida leader and key plotter in the 9/11 attacks.

TITLE: Music Midtown pulls the plug over Georgia's gun laws, highlighting a legal gray area
SUMMARY: <em>The Atlanta Journal-Constitution

TITLE: As species recover, some threaten others in more dire shape
SUMMARY: Scientists face a challenge: A troubled species rebounds thanks to restoration efforts, only to make things worse for others by preying on them or outcompeting them for food and living space.

TITLE: Bin Laden was the face of al-Qaida, but Ayman al-Zawahiri was its hate-filled heart
SUMMARY: Al-Zawahiri was deeply involved in the planning of 9/11, and led the organization after bin Laden was killed in 2011. He died in a U.S. drone strike in Afghanistan on Sunday.

TITLE: California declares a state of emergency due to monkeypox outbreak
SUMMARY: The first California case of the current outbreak of monkeypox was confirmed May 25. There are now more than 800 cases in the state, according to Gov. Gavin Newsom.

TITLE: Pelosi arrives in Malaysia as tensions rise over possible Taiwan visit
SUMMARY: Local media in Taiwan reported the U.S. House speaker will arrive in Taipei on Tuesday night, becoming the highest-ranking elected U.S. official to visit in more than 25 years.

TITLE: They lost Medicaid when paperwork was sent to a pasture, signaling the mess to come
SUMMARY: Tennessee expects to soon disenroll about 300,000 people from Medicaid. But families like the Lesters have been entangled in bureaucracy and clerical mistakes, causing them to unfairly lose coverage.

TITLE: The Space Force is scrapping the annual fitness test in favor of wearable trackers
SUMMARY: The new approach aims to promote overall fitness instead of focusing on specific exercises, and the devices will also give Guardians feedback about mental health, balanced eating and sleep.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Michigan
SUMMARY: In Michigan, several Republicans are vying to take on incumbent Gov. Gretchen Whitmer. And there are notable primaries for several U.S. House seats.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Missouri
SUMMARY: Missouri's top race is an open contest for U.S. Senate following the retirement of Republican Roy Blunt.

TITLE: A librarian collects all the things left in books — from love letters to old photos
SUMMARY: The Oakland Public Library has spent years collecting items its patrons have left in library books, from old photographs to love notes. The archive is available publicly on their website.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Washington
SUMMARY: In Washington, two Republicans who voted to impeach then-President Donald Trump are aiming to fend off primary opponents.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Kansas
SUMMARY: Kansans vote on a state constitutional amendment that could open the door to more abortion restrictions in the wake of the U.S. Supreme Court's decision to overturn <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: There are a slew of significant primaries Tuesday. Here's what we're watching for
SUMMARY: Election deniers, abortion and Trump's rampage against Republicans who voted to impeach him. It's a busy first primary night in August in five states, including battleground Arizona.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Arizona
SUMMARY: Arizona is one of the most closely watched states in the nation, with competitive primaries for U.S. Senate, U.S. House, governor, attorney general and secretary of state.

TITLE: Stephen King is set to testify for the government in books merger trial
SUMMARY: The author of "Carrie," "The Shining" and many other favorites, King has willingly — even eagerly — placed himself in opposition to Simon & Schuster, his longtime publisher.

TITLE: The Michigan Republican primary for governor has been a bumpy ride. It ends today
SUMMARY: First, five candidates for governor were disqualified from the ballot. Then, the FBI arrested another one. After Tuesday, Michigan Republicans still face the biggest challenge yet — Gov. Whitmer.

TITLE: Beyoncé will change a lyric in her latest album after accusations of ableism
SUMMARY: Beyoncé's publicist confirmed that the artist will replace an offensive lyric from a song in her latest album, <em>Renaissance

TITLE: The Ukrainian women who make art in the face of war
SUMMARY: Activists as well as artists, these women are responding in paint, photographs and videos to the Russian invasion.

TITLE: Today, Kansans face a high-stakes decision on the future of abortion rights
SUMMARY: Tuesday, voters in Kansas will be the first in the nation to vote on abortion since the U.S. Supreme Court overturned <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: After an abortion shakeup Monday in Michigan, voters head to the polls Tuesday
SUMMARY: Action in the Michigan courts Monday blurred the lines on abortion rights in the state. Tuesday, Republicans decide their nominee for governor who will face Gov. Gretchen Whitmer in November.

TITLE: After devastating floods, Kentucky residents now face high heat and power outages
SUMMARY: "It's going to take years to rebuild. People left with absolutely nothing," said Gov. Andy Beshear, as recovery begins. "And we continue to find bodies of our brothers and sisters that we have lost."

TITLE: Pelosi has landed in Taiwan. Here's why that's a big deal
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is making an unannounced, but widely anticipated, stop in Taiwan. The move is expected to increase already heightened tensions between the U.S. and China.

TITLE: Lyons Magnus recalls 53 products including alternative milks and protein shakes
SUMMARY: The products being recalled range from pre-made coffees to protein shakes and other nutritional beverages. Though no illnesses have been reported, the recalled products should be thrown out.

TITLE: New book chronicles how America's opioid industry operated like a drug cartel
SUMMARY: Two Washington Post journalists say pharmaceutical companies collaborated with each other — and with lawyers and lobbyists — to create laws to protect the industry. Their new book is American Cartel.

TITLE: Abortion is illegal or heavily restricted in at least 12 states
SUMMARY: Abortion is a major issue in today's primary elections. Here's the current state of laws banning or heavily restricting abortion nationwide.

TITLE: Why the U.N. chief says we are 'one miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation'
SUMMARY: It's not the first time for such a dire warning. Here's a brief look at why Guterres and others are raising the alarm now.

TITLE: Greg Norman says Tiger Woods turned down a $700-800M Saudi offer to play LIV Golf
SUMMARY: Woods has been opposed to LIV Golf since late last year. LIV Golf currently has only one player — Dustin Johnson at No. 18 — from the top 20 in the world.

TITLE: Pennsylvania's mail-in voting law is upheld by the state's Supreme Court
SUMMARY: All voters in the key swing state can continue casting ballots by mail now that the Pennsylvania Supreme Court has upheld a law that was challenged by some GOP state lawmakers who helped pass it.

TITLE: Music industry titan Mo Ostin who worked with Sinatra, Hendrix and Prince dies at 95
SUMMARY: Ostin signed deals with major pop and rock talent over the decades, including Joni Mitchell, Fleetwood Mac and R.E.M. He said the industry didn't have to prioritize sales over artistic freedom.

TITLE: The vote in Kansas on abortion could be close
SUMMARY: The fate of abortion in Kansas could be in the hands of voters today. They'll decide whether the state constitution explicitly does not protect the right to an abortion.

TITLE: In Kansas, Democratic Gov. Laura Kelly may sail through primary, but not reelection
SUMMARY: Incumbent Gov. Laura Kelly, a Democrat, faces an uphill battle in the November election against her expected challenger, Republican Kansas Attorney General Derek Schmidt.

TITLE: Opinion: What Ayman al-Zawahiri's death means for al-Qaida's future
SUMMARY: Zawahiri's death places al-Qaida in a precarious position, argues Colin P. Clarke of the Soufan Center. The question of succession will help shape al-Qaida now — and it may prove divisive.

TITLE: Four people have died in Northern California's huge wildfire
SUMMARY: The death toll doubled when two additional bodies were found within the burn zone of the McKinney Fire, the state's largest blaze of the year.

TITLE: Opinion: Life hacks from India on how to stay cool (without an air conditioner)
SUMMARY: Heat wave researcher Gulrez Shah Azhar grew up in Uttar Pradesh, India, without an A/C unit. He shares tips on how to deal with the heat — including wearing a wet scarf around your neck.

TITLE: Pregnant? Georgia says that fetus counts as a dependent on your taxes
SUMMARY: A person at least six weeks pregnant on or after July 20 through Dec. 31, 2022, can submit the fetus as a dependent on their state tax returns starting next year.

TITLE: NFL punishes Miami Dolphins owner over inquiry into tanking, tampering and Tom Brady
SUMMARY: "I know of no prior instance of a team violating the prohibition on tampering with both a head coach and star player" over several years, NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell said.

TITLE: There's a spotlight on the primary for AG in Arizona because of abortion
SUMMARY: Post-Roe, Arizona's abortion law is confusing and the candidates for state attorney general say they'll clear it up. The Democrat is for abortion rights and the Republicans are against them.

TITLE: What 3 past Taiwan Strait crises can teach us about U.S.-China tensions today
SUMMARY: Both the U.S. and China stepped up military activity in the region ahead of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. Here's what is different now from crises in the Taiwan Strait decades ago.

TITLE: Nationals star Juan Soto heads to the Padres in a blockbuster deal
SUMMARY: San Diego acquired the superstar outfielder in one of baseball's biggest deals at the trade deadline, vaulting their postseason chances by adding one of the game's best young hitters.

TITLE: An Idaho abortion law draws a Justice Department lawsuit
SUMMARY: The DOJ argues that a restrictive new ban conflicts with a federal law that requires doctors to give pregnant women appropriate medical care, including abortion when necessary.

TITLE: The father of a Sandy Hook victim says Alex Jones has made his life a 'living hell'
SUMMARY: Neil Heslin, whose 6-year-old son was killed in the Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre in 2012, testified that he has endured online abuse, anonymous phone calls and harassment on the street.

TITLE: Many eyes are on Arizona's open seats in Tuesday's primary
SUMMARY: In Arizona, three key statewide races have no incumbents, and former President Trump has played a big role in endorsing Republicans for those offices.

TITLE: Robinhood cuts nearly a quarter of its staff as the pandemic darling loses its shine
SUMMARY: Robinhood – the company that became a household name during the pandemic – is cutting staff, citing a deteriorating economy and worsening market.

TITLE: Michigan results steam in
SUMMARY: Incumbent Gov. Gretchen Whitmer is running unopposed, but there are five Republicans in the GOP primary for governor Tuesday.

TITLE: Gov. Laura Kelly and Kansas AG Derek Schmidt to face one another in November
SUMMARY: It will be a tight race between incumbent Gov. Laura Kelly, a Democrat, and Kansas state Attorney General Derek Schmidt, a Republican, for leadership of the state in November.

TITLE: Voters in Kansas are the first to decide on abortion post-Roe
SUMMARY: The question before voters in Kansas is whether to add an amendment to the state constitution that would say there is no right to an abortion there.

TITLE: Michigan results stream in
SUMMARY: Incumbent Gov. Gretchen Whitmer is running unopposed, but there are five Republicans in the GOP primary for governor Tuesday.

TITLE: Voters in Kansas decide to keep abortion legal in the state, rejecting an amendment
SUMMARY: In the first test of its kind since the <em>Dobbs

TITLE: Schmitt wins Missouri GOP Senate primary, topping Hartzler, scandal-plagued Greitens
SUMMARY: Missouri Republicans picked Attorney General Eric Schmitt to advance in the state's unpredictable U.S. Senate race, a move that seems likely to keep the seat out of reach for Democrats.

TITLE: Tudor Dixon will face Gov. Gretchen Whitmer in Michigan race for governor
SUMMARY: Republican Tudor Dixon, who is an abortion rights opponent and is backed by former President Trump, will face Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer in the Michigan race for governor in November.

TITLE: Vin Scully, the famed Los Angeles Dodgers baseball broadcaster, has died
SUMMARY: The longtime Dodgers broadcaster was known for his quick wit, keen insight and deep baseball knowledge. His distinct voice was a joy to listen to and for a half-century he was Dodgers baseball.

TITLE: The Senate passes help for veterans exposed to toxins, after a reversal drew fury
SUMMARY: The bill no longer would force generations of veterans to prove that their illness was caused by toxic exposures suffered in the military in order to get VA coverage.

TITLE: Katie Hobbs wins the Democratic primary for governor in Arizona
SUMMARY: Katie Hobbs wins the Democratic primary for governor in Arizona, but the Republican race remains too close to call.

TITLE: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says the U.S. will not abandon Taiwan as China protests
SUMMARY: Pelosi's trip has heightened U.S.-China tensions more than visits by other members of Congress because of her high-level position as leader of the House of Representatives.

TITLE: Katie Hobbs wins Arizona Democratic primary for governor. GOP race too close to call
SUMMARY: Katie Hobbs wins the Democratic primary for governor in Arizona, but the Republican race remains too close to call.

TITLE: Explaining the $14 billion tax 'loophole' that Senate Democrats want to close
SUMMARY: The "carried interest loophole" allows hedge fund managers to tax their income at a lower rate than an ordinary salary. The provision is unpopular — yet it has survived many attempts to eliminate it.

TITLE: How the U.S. lost the Next Big Thing to China — again
SUMMARY: Taxpayers spent $15 million on research to build a breakthrough battery. Then the U.S. government gave it to China.

TITLE: Overdose reversal drugs gain support at music festivals, but not fentanyl test strips
SUMMARY: Festival promoters are allowing lifesaving medication as fentanyl deaths surge, but volunteers are often left to distribute it, and more controversial forms of harm reduction aren't openly allowed.

TITLE: Samuel Alito, a workhorse on the Supreme Court, shapes its conservative path
SUMMARY: The justice has played a key role on the court, often leading the charge not just on abortion, but for expanded religious rights, against LGBTQ rights, against expanded voting rights, and more

TITLE: Rep. Peter Meijer narrowly loses to Trump-endorsed challenger in Michigan primary
SUMMARY: Freshman Republican Rep. Peter Meijer voted to impeach Trump following the Jan. 6 insurrection on the U.S. Capitol.

TITLE: New Zealand's national climate plan includes possibly seeking higher ground
SUMMARY: New Zealand's first-ever climate adaptation plan includes the possibility of moving some communities to higher ground, but doesn't explain how much the changes will cost and who will pay.

TITLE: Election denier Finchem wins GOP nomination to oversee voting in Arizona
SUMMARY: Mark Finchem was at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, and is a longstanding member of the right-wing extremist group the Oath Keepers.

TITLE: Blake Masters, Trump pick funded by billionaire Thiel, wins Arizona Senate primary
SUMMARY: Masters, who beat out a crowded field of primary contenders, will face Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly in November in one of the most closely watched races.

TITLE: In Sri Lanka, inflation means food shortages, blackouts — and days-long lines for gas
SUMMARY: Sri Lanka offers a cautionary tale for countries struggling with inflation. Anger over fuel lines spilled into the streets and toppled a government. Will nationalism surge, or unity prevail?

TITLE: Floods are getting more common. Do you know your risk?
SUMMARY: Climate change means more rain and higher seas, which adds up to more flooded homes. Even a small amount of water indoors can cost a lot.

TITLE: Talk of 'invasion' moves from the fringe to the mainstream of GOP immigration message
SUMMARY: With midterm elections looming, many Republican candidates have embraced increasingly extreme language about immigration. Immigrant advocates worry that such rhetoric stokes fear and hate.

TITLE: Binders, backpacks... and inflation are on this year's back-to-school shopping list
SUMMARY: This year's back-to-school shopping season lands in the middle of the highest inflation in four decades — how will this affect spending?

TITLE: New York City works to make space for rapidly rising number of asylum-seekers
SUMMARY: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announces emergency contracts to help an increasing number of newly arrived immigrants access shelter

TITLE: A young officer hopes to turn the tide of war, as Ukraine fights to retake a key city
SUMMARY: A 29-year-old battalion commander is leading 600 men, fighting in Ukraine's counteroffensive near Kherson. "This is war," Col. Serhiy Shatalov says. "You cannot predict nothing, absolutely nothing."

TITLE: Tonga's volcano sent tons of water into the stratosphere. That could warm the Earth
SUMMARY: "We've never seen anything like it," said atmospheric scientist Luis Millán, who works at NASA. The vapor sent skyward by the eruption will likely stay in the stratosphere for years.

TITLE: A record amount of seaweed is choking shores in the Caribbean
SUMMARY: Seaweed is smothering Caribbean coasts from Puerto Rico to Barbados as tons of brown algae kill wildlife, choke the tourism industry and release toxic gases.

TITLE: This tax loophole made hedge managers rich. Closing it may help fund the climate bill
SUMMARY: The "carried interest loophole" allows hedge fund managers to tax their income at a lower rate than an ordinary salary. The provision is unpopular — yet it has survived many attempts to eliminate it.

TITLE: The U.S. made a breakthrough battery discovery — then gave the technology to China
SUMMARY: Taxpayers spent $15 million on research to build a breakthrough battery. Then the U.S. government gave it to China.

TITLE: Warner Bros. kills off 'Batgirl' movie, $90 million in
SUMMARY: Sorry, DC universe fans: the movie, which starred 'In The Heights' actress Leslie Grace in the title role, will not be released theatrically or on HBO Max.

TITLE: How climate change drives inland floods
SUMMARY: As the Earth heats up, heavy rain is getting more common across the United States. That means more severe floods happen more often.

TITLE: 2 podcasts look back at the messy decades of the American counter-culture
SUMMARY: Mother Country Radicals explores the history of the militant left-wing group the Weather Underground. I Was Never There

TITLE: Remembering alternative radio pioneer Larry Josephson
SUMMARY: Josephson, who died July 27, started out in 1966 as the host of a free-form morning show on WBAI in New York  He later hosted shows and told jokes on many public radio stations.

TITLE: College is increasingly out of reach for many students. What went wrong?
SUMMARY: Journalist Will Bunch says instead of opening the door to a better life, college leaves many students deep in debt and unable to find well-paying jobs. His new book is After the Ivory Tower Falls.

TITLE: Alex Jones concedes that the Sandy Hook attack was '100% real'
SUMMARY: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones testified that he now understands it was irresponsible of him to declare the Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre a hoax.

TITLE: Ukraine's wedding dress industry is alive and well, despite the war
SUMMARY: The town of Chernivtsi, once the wedding dress capital of the Soviet Union, is still churning out dresses — for the West. "We are staying in Ukraine," says a dressmaker. "We will build our economy."

TITLE: Does the killing of al-Zawahiri make Americans safer? It's complicated
SUMMARY: The State Department warns of potential anti-American violence following the U.S. killing of al-Qaida leader Ayman al-Zawahiri. Experts say his loss hurts the group, but doesn't erase the threat.

TITLE: Mickelson and other pros sue over PGA suspensions for playing in LIV Golf events
SUMMARY: Players who defected to Saudi-funded LIV Golf filed an antitrust lawsuit against the PGA Tour, the first step in a legal fight that could define the rules of where players can compete.

TITLE: Highland Park parade shooting suspect pleads not guilty
SUMMARY: The man accused of killing seven people and wounding dozens more in a shooting at an Independence Day parade in suburban Chicago pleaded not guilty on Wednesday.

TITLE: Emi Nietfeld is done reaching for redemption in 'Acceptance'
SUMMARY: The memoir is not a phoenix-rising-from-the-ashes tale. Instead, Nietfeld refuses silver linings and focuses on the toll of contorting oneself into a "perfect, deserving" victim.

TITLE: Biden's national security advisor doubles down on Taiwan policy after Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: The President's National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan discusses the war in Ukraine, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan, and the U.S. drone strike that took out al-Qaida's leader.

TITLE: The U.S. has sanctioned Vladimir Putin's long-rumored romantic partner
SUMMARY: Rumors of a relationship between Putin, 69, and Alina Kabaeva, 39, date back more than a decade. Putin and the former Olympic gymnast are thought to have had at least three children together.

TITLE: Pelosi's Taiwan trip leaves Asian countries nervously awaiting China's response
SUMMARY: From the Philippines to Singapore, countries are worried the status quo could turn from tension to conflict. Southeast Asia especially feels the strain of living in the shadow of U.S.-China rivalry.

TITLE: NFL appeal opens the possibility for a longer suspension for Browns QB Deshaun Watson
SUMMARY: The NFL is appealing a disciplinary officer's decision to suspend Deshaun Watson for six games for violating the league's personal conduct policy over sexual misconduct allegations.

TITLE: U.S. Rep. Jackie Walorski dies in a car crash
SUMMARY: The 58-year-old Republican lawmaker was killed Wednesday in a car accident in her northern Indiana District, according to her office. Three others also died in the crash.

TITLE: U.S. Senate approves Finland and Sweden for membership into NATO
SUMMARY: Wednesday's vote for the candidacy of two Western European nations took a crucial step toward expansion of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

TITLE: Biden's national security adviser doubles down on Taiwan policy after Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: Jake Sullivan, the president's national security adviser, discusses the war in Ukraine, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan and the U.S. drone strike that took out al-Qaida's leader.

TITLE: Coral levels in some parts of the Great Barrier Reef are at the highest in 36 years
SUMMARY: While higher water temperatures led to a coral bleaching event in some areas in March, the temperatures did not climb high enough to kill the coral, according to the Australian government.

TITLE: To this retired commander, the ISS was the last good bond between the U.S. and Russia
SUMMARY: Retired Air Force colonel and NASA astronaut Terry Virts commanded the ISS in 2014 and 2015, but says he wouldn't want to partner with Russia in space until it leaves Ukraine and pays for the damage.

TITLE: Biden used to keep Trump mentions to a minimum. Not anymore
SUMMARY: With the midterms approaching and lots of chatter about whether Biden will run in 2024, Donald Trump is a useful foil for the president once again.

TITLE: How to protect the people you care about from extreme heat
SUMMARY: Heat waves can take a toll on our health, and some people are especially vulnerable. But you can do a lot to look out for those who are at higher risk of heat-related illness.

TITLE: Closing arguments are set to begin Thursday in Brittney Griner's drug case in Russia
SUMMARY: Given that Russian courts rarely acquit defendants and Griner has acknowledged that there were vape canisters with cannabis oil in her luggage, judges have considerable latitude on sentencing.

TITLE: He lived in Oregon and she lived in England. A drawing of a cat brought them together
SUMMARY: When Grant Schroeder commissioned a drawing of his cat, Luna, he figured that was it. But he got a lot more when Emma Ferguson, who also had a cat named Luna, took notice. Soon a romance bloomed.

TITLE: Why do so many bikes end up underwater? The reasons can be weird and varied
SUMMARY: Each year, thousands of bikes are thrown into waterways. Author Jody Rosen explains the history, and possible motivations for this strange phenomenon.

TITLE: The driver in a hit-and-run that killed Nicki Minaj's father is sentence to one year
SUMMARY: Charles Polevich pleaded guilty to leaving the scene and tampering with evidence in the crash on New York's Long Island that killed Robert Maraj.

TITLE: China says it carried out precision missile strikes in the Taiwan Strait
SUMMARY: China is conducting military exercises that have raised tensions in the region to their highest level in decades. The drills were prompted by a visit to Taiwan by U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

TITLE: Russian prosecutor asks judges for a nearly 10-year sentence for Brittney Griner
SUMMARY: Griner's defense attorney will also speak at Thursday's court session in Moscow, and the basketball star will likely give a statement on her own behalf as her trial on drug charges winds to a close.

TITLE: Russian prosecutor asks court for a nearly 10-year sentence for Brittney Griner
SUMMARY: Griner's defense attorney called for her to be acquitted, or for the court to show leniency in any punishment she's given, as the month-long trial in Russia on drug charges winds down.

TITLE: China fires waves of missiles over the Taiwan Strait, raising tensions in the region
SUMMARY: China has fired several waves of missiles, hitting targets in the waters that encircle the island of Taiwan, after a visit from Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi triggered a tense military standoff.

TITLE: A Russian court finds WNBA star Brittney Griner guilty on drug charges
SUMMARY: The ruling came nearly six months after Griner was detained. Russia has indicated that any potential deal or prisoner swap to secure her release would have to wait until after a verdict in her case.

TITLE: The Netflix v. 'Unofficial Bridgerton Musical' lawsuit, explained
SUMMARY: Netflix is suing Abigail Barlow and Emily Bear, who wrote the Grammy-winning <em>Unofficial Bridgerton Musical

TITLE: A Russian court sentences WNBA star Brittney Griner to 9 years on drug charges
SUMMARY: The ruling came nearly six months after Griner was detained. Russia has indicated that any potential deal or prisoner swap to secure her release would have to wait until after a verdict in her case.

TITLE: Undercover journalist in Afghanistan finds Taliban are abducting, imprisoning women
SUMMARY: Filmmaker Ramita Navai has seen girls and women forced to marry Taliban members or arrested for violating the morality code. Her new PBS Frontline documentary is <em>Afghanistan Undercover.

TITLE: How the 2022 midterms strategy could change after the Kansas abortion vote
SUMMARY: Republican and Democratic strategists are recalibrating how much of an issue abortion rights will play in the midterm elections after a decisive vote by Kansans in favor of abortion rights.

TITLE: The Parkland jury gets a rare view of the school massacre site
SUMMARY: Jurors in the trial of Florida school shooter Nikolas Cruz toured the still blood-spattered rooms of a three-story building at Parkland's Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School on Thursday.

TITLE: A judge unleased a tirade on a prominent Jan. 6 defendant for his post-plea comments
SUMMARY: Brandon Straka pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor for egging on rioters during the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol. The judge in the case said he has since made "questionable" comments about his plea.

TITLE: A massive sinkhole just discovered in Chile has authorities puzzled
SUMMARY: The 656-foot-deep sinkhole was found Saturday near a mining site. Investigators are working to determine what caused the sinkhole to open, and say they have seen a lot of water inside.

TITLE: The driver in a hit-and-run that killed Nicki Minaj's father is sentenced to one year
SUMMARY: Charles Polevich pleaded guilty to leaving the scene and tampering with evidence in the crash on New York's Long Island that killed Robert Maraj.

TITLE: White House declares monkeypox a public health emergency
SUMMARY: Declaring a public health emergency can free up resources to help the administration respond to the monkeypox outbreak. So far more than 6,000 people in the U.S. have been infected.

TITLE: Former Puerto Rico Gov. Wanda Vázquez is charged with bribery
SUMMARY: Vázquez was arrested on bribery charges related to the financing of her 2020 campaign. She is accused of engaging in a scheme with several people, including a bank owner and a former FBI agent.

TITLE: Today in Nashville, 9 Republicans run for a seat redistricted out of Democrats' reach
SUMMARY: GOP lawmakers in Tennessee have redrawn Nashville from one Democratic congressional district into three GOP-leaning districts. Democrats will have a difficult, if not impossible, time getting elected.

TITLE: A suspect who was mistakenly freed in the theft of Lady Gaga's dogs is recaptured
SUMMARY: James Howard Jackson was arrested nearly five months after he was released from jail while awaiting trial "due to a clerical error," the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department said.

TITLE: The Jan. 6 committee is asking for data from Alex Jones' phone, a lawyer says
SUMMARY: An attorney representing two parents who sued conspiracy theorist Alex Jones over his false claims about the Sandy Hook massacre said the House committee has requested records from Jones' phone.

TITLE: A judge unleashed a tirade on a prominent Jan. 6 defendant for his post-plea comments
SUMMARY: Brandon Straka pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor for egging on rioters during the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol. The judge in the case said he has since made "questionable" comments about his plea.

TITLE: Senate will take up Democrats' tax, climate and health bill on Saturday, Schumer says
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer has repeatedly said Democrats are on track to pass the Inflation Reduction Act in the coming days, but a few roadblocks still stand in the way.

TITLE: Four people are found dead in two burning homes in Nebraska
SUMMARY: A man was seen driving away from the city of Laurel before the bodies were discovered and that investigators wanted to speak to him, a Nebraska State Patrol official said.

TITLE: A jury says InfoWars' Alex Jones must pay 2 Sandy Hook parents more than $4 million
SUMMARY: The InfoWars host and creator will have to pay $4.1 million to two parents whose 6-year-old son was killed at Sandy Hook Elementary in 2012. Jones spent years claiming the mass shooting as a hoax.

TITLE: 4 current and former officers federally charged in raid that killed Breonna Taylor
SUMMARY: The charges announced by Attorney General Merrit Garland on Thursday include civil rights violations, conspiracy, use of excessive force offenses and obstruction.

TITLE: Kari Lake, news anchor turned election denier, is Arizona GOP nominee for governor
SUMMARY: Kari Lake, who has spent her campaign spreading election lies, was endorsed by Trump. Her rival, Karrin Taylor Robson, was backed by Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey and former Vice President Mike Pence.

TITLE: Sinema says she will move forward with Senate Democrats' climate, health and tax bill
SUMMARY: The Arizona senator said late Thursday that she will move forward with the Inflation Reduction Act after Democrats reached an agreement to narrow the carried interest tax provision.

TITLE: The Bank of England predicts a lengthy recession at the end of the year
SUMMARY: Soaring natural gas prices are likely to drive consumer price inflation to 13.3% in October, the bank said. That will push Britain into recession later this year, bank forecasts show.

TITLE: A fire at a music pub in eastern Thailand kills at least 13
SUMMARY: Video circulating on social media showed people fleeing the pub while thick black smoke billowed from the door and then the entrance through which people were escaping was suddenly engulfed in flames.

TITLE: New data sheds light on one method to combat election lies
SUMMARY: Positive messaging about democratic values like freedom and unity seems to have a meaningful effect on whether voters say they trust voting results.

TITLE: China's military drills around Taiwan show how it is closing the gap with the U.S.
SUMMARY: A series of military drills launched in the wake of Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan this week show how China's military has made dramatic gains since the last crisis over the island democracy.

TITLE: GOP governors sent buses of migrants to D.C. — with no plan for what came next
SUMMARY: For months, governors of Texas and Arizona have been sending charter buses full of migrants to Washington D.C.  Neither the local nor federal government greets them when they arrive.

TITLE: We visited a Taliban leader's compound to examine his vision for Afghanistan
SUMMARY: On the day a U.S. drone strike killed the leader of al-Qaida in Afghanistan, NPR sat down for an interview with the man in charge of the country's defense.

TITLE: An animal tranquilizer is making street drugs even more dangerous
SUMMARY: The sedative xylazine is starting to permeate illegal opioids and cocaine. It does not respond to naloxone, an overdose reversal medication, and may be to blame for grisly injuries and infections.

TITLE: Amnesty International says Ukraine's military has been risking its civilians' lives
SUMMARY: A report says Ukraine placed its forces near noncombatants, putting them in danger. Government officials say they evacuate civilians from combat areas, and that the report depicts "a false reality."

TITLE: A Banksy painting that was sprayed in the West Bank resurfaces in Tel Aviv
SUMMARY: The relocation of the painting — a slingshot-toting rat and likely intended to protest the Israel occupation — raises ethical questions about the removal of artwork from occupied territory.

TITLE: Attendance at Yellowstone National Park plummets after road washouts in June
SUMMARY: Yellowstone visitation is down 40% after historic floods washed out roads. One neighboring town is struggling to survive, so park officials have opened a temporary road to try to help.

TITLE: How 3 presidents announced the deaths of terrorist leaders and what it says about them
SUMMARY: The way Barack Obama, Donald Trump and Joe Biden announced the deaths of terrorist chiefs revealed much about their own leadership.

TITLE: New Zealand considers changing its name to confront its troubled colonial past
SUMMARY: As the people of New Zealand confront their nation's troubled past with colonization, a return to the Maori name of Aotearoa is being presented to a parliamentary committee.

TITLE: Abortion rights supporters and opponents look for lessons from the Kansas vote
SUMMARY: Kentucky has a similar measure on the ballot, and another is expected in Michigan. But even as advocates analyze the results, they warn that messaging that worked in Kansas may not work nationwide.

TITLE: A jury will decide if Alex Jones has to pay punitive damages to Sandy Hook parents
SUMMARY: Jones is being sued for defamation by the parents of a first grader killed at Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012 for saying the school shooting was a hoax on his radio show.

TITLE: The job market got even better, in a surprisingly positive sign for the economy
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added 528,000 jobs in July, showing the labor market remains strong, despite high inflation and softening economic growth. The unemployment rate fell to 3.5%.

TITLE: On Japan's Yonaguni island, fears of being on the front line of a Taiwan conflict
SUMMARY: Japan's westernmost island lies in sight of Taiwan, less than 70 miles away. On Thursday, a Chinese missile landed near Yonaguni. Japan has been strengthening defenses across its southwest islands.

TITLE: New studio execs slay 'Batgirl,' but she's been through tougher fights
SUMMARY: Warner Bros. Discovery has shelved production of its film <em>Batgirl

TITLE: China halts climate and military dialogue with the U.S. over Pelosi's Taiwan visit
SUMMARY: China said it is canceling or suspending dialogue with the U.S. on a range of issues from climate change to military relations and anti-drug efforts in retaliation for Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

TITLE: 2 people killed after lightning struck near the White House
SUMMARY: Intense thunderstorms killed two and critically injured another two at the park next to the White House in Washington, D.C. Thursday evening. U.S. Park Police and the Secret Service rushed to help.

TITLE: Democratic strategists take stock of President Biden's job performance
SUMMARY: President Biden has a low overall approval rating. NPR's Asma Khalid talks to Democratic strategists Ben LaBolt and Chris Hunley about Democrats options ahead of midterm elections.

TITLE: How many animal species have caught COVID? First global tracker has (partial) answers
SUMMARY: Just as human counts are incomplete, so are animal counts. But the first worldwide compilation of animal cases is a start at understanding the extent of human-to-animal transmission, scientists say.

TITLE: 2 people were killed by a lightning strike near the White House
SUMMARY: Intense thunderstorms killed two and critically injured another two at the park next to the White House in Washington, D.C. Thursday evening. U.S. Park Police and the Secret Service rushed to help.

TITLE: Amnesty International's report criticizing Ukraine is dividing the rights group
SUMMARY: A report says Ukraine placed its forces near noncombatants, putting them in danger. Government officials say they evacuate civilians from combat areas, and that the report depicts "a false reality."

TITLE: What Biden's low approval ratings and high-profile wins could mean for the midterms
SUMMARY: While midterms are typically a challenge for the party in power, two Democratic strategists say Biden's recent wins — and the threat of Republican control of Congress — could galvanize voters.

TITLE: Confusion roiled Michigan for days as abortion rights changed hour to hour
SUMMARY: In a span of 3 days this week, court rulings seesawed between outlawing abortions and permitting them. A judge allowed them to continue Wednesday for at least 21 days.

TITLE: Remembering NBA legend Bill Russell
SUMMARY: Russell, who died July 31, led the Boston Celtics to 11 NBA titles. He was also the first Black head coach in the NBA and a civil rights activist. <em>Originally broadcast in 2001.

TITLE: Young Americans are living at home longer. We want to hear your stories on why
SUMMARY: Recent studies have found younger Americans are living at home longer. Are you aged between 18 and 34 and living in a multigenerational household? We want to hear from you.

TITLE: Amazon is buying Roomba vacuum maker iRobot for $1.7 billion
SUMMARY: iRobot is most famous for the circular-shaped Roomba vacuum, which would join voice assistant Alexa and Ring security cameras among smart home features offered by Amazon.

TITLE: The Angola 3's Albert Woodfox, who survived decades of solitary confinement, dies
SUMMARY: A wrongful murder conviction forced Woodfox to spend 43 years and 10 months in solitary confinement at Louisiana's Angola Prison. He has died at the age of 75.

TITLE: A jury tags Alex Jones with $45.2 million in punitive damages for 2 Sandy Hook parents
SUMMARY: Jones, the creator and face of the conspiracy-peddling website InfoWars, is on the hook for a total of $49.3 million for spreading falsehoods about the 2012 mass shooting at an elementary school.

TITLE: GOP Rep. Dan Newhouse, who voted to impeach Trump, advances in Wash. primary
SUMMARY: Newhouse will face Democrat Doug White in November's general election in the heavily Republican district.

TITLE: Congress is about to act on drug price reform. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: A deal on the table in Congress would help deliver on a long-time promise: to make prescription drugs more affordable. It includes a $2,000 cap on out-of-pocket expenses for Medicare patients.

TITLE: Democrats could be on the brink of success as the Senate takes a up a hard-fought bill
SUMMARY: The wide-ranging legislation targets climate change, health care costs and taxes. Majority Leader Chuck Schumer says he will start the voting process on the bill Saturday.

TITLE: In Kansas and Arizona, voters defy expectations to chart their own course
SUMMARY: People bristle and resist when told what they can or cannot do. We knew this about guns, vaccinations and masks. And we are seeing some of that with regard to abortion rights, even in red states.

TITLE: At CPAC, some Trump supporters aren't totally in love with the idea of a 2024 run
SUMMARY: Donald Trump returns to the Conservative Political Action Conference in Dallas on Saturday. Some attendees worry the controversy following him could be a liability in the next presidential campaign.

TITLE: An ex-Marine details the chaotic exit from Afghanistan — and how we should mark it
SUMMARY: As the U.S. withdrew from Afghanistan last year, Marine Corps veteran Elliot Ackerman was frantically rebuilding a network of old allies to help desperate Afghans escape.

TITLE: How colleges are preparing for a new public health threat: monkeypox
SUMMARY: The risk of contracting monkeypox is still low in the U.S., but colleges are already seeing cases.

TITLE: Steve's heart stopped five times. Quick thinking by his wife helped saved his life
SUMMARY: Steve Cline was at home with his wife Annette last December when his heart suddenly stopped. Quick thinking and some help from a 911 dispatcher meant he made a full recovery.

TITLE: How Alex Jones helped mainstream conspiracy theories into American life
SUMMARY: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones must pay millions in damages for spreading lies about the Sandy Hook school massacre. But even if the penalties shut down Infowars, his influence will remain.

TITLE: Indiana becomes 1st state to approve abortion ban post Roe
SUMMARY: Indiana on Friday became the first state in the nation to approve abortion restrictions since the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, as the Republican governor quickly signed a near-total ban.

TITLE: Israel and Gaza militants exchange fire after deadly strikes
SUMMARY: Israeli jets pounded militant targets in Gaza early Saturday as rockets rained on southern Israel, hours after a wave of Israeli airstrikes on the coastal enclave killed at least 11 people.

TITLE: Gas prices are finally dropping. Here are 4 things to know
SUMMARY: The average price of gasoline nationwide is expected to drop below $4 a gallon in the coming days as prices continue to fall from the record highs hit in June.

TITLE: In the 'gray zone' outside Kherson, Ukraine's soldiers pay a terrible price
SUMMARY: Ukrainian officials have vowed to retake the strategic city of Kherson. But the battlefield "gray zone," spanning more than 100 miles, is confusing — and danger can come in many forms.

TITLE: A blaze kills a firefighter's 10 relatives, 3 of them children
SUMMARY: Fire tore quickly through a house in northeastern Pennsylvania, horrifying a volunteer firefighter who arrived to battle the blaze only to discover the victims were his own family.

TITLE: How Alex Jones helped mainstream conspiracy theories become part of American life
SUMMARY: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones must pay millions in damages for spreading lies about the Sandy Hook school massacre. But even if the penalties shut down Infowars, his influence will remain.

TITLE: President Biden has tested negative for COVID again but will remain in isolation
SUMMARY: President Biden is negative for COVID-19 after a rebound case but will remain in isolation pending a second negative test, the White House announced on Saturday.

TITLE: Flash floods turn Death Valley muddy, stranding hundreds of visitors
SUMMARY: Record rainfall trigged flash floods at Death Valley National Park that swept away cars, closed all roads and stranded hundreds of visitors and workers.

TITLE: A former Marine details the chaotic exit from Afghanistan — and how we should mark it
SUMMARY: As the U.S. withdrew from Afghanistan last year, Marine Corps veteran Elliot Ackerman was frantically rebuilding a network of old allies to help desperate Afghans escape.

TITLE: Anne Heche's reported hospitalization after a car crash divides social media
SUMMARY: The 53-year-old, who first rose to fame on the soap opera <em>Another World

TITLE: Senate Democrats gear up to advance their sweeping health, climate and tax bill
SUMMARY: The wide-ranging legislation targets climate change, health care costs and taxes. Majority Leader Chuck Schumer says he will start the voting process on the bill Saturday.

TITLE: With record-breaking heat, zoos are finding ways to keep their animals cool
SUMMARY: Extreme temperatures are taking a toll on zoo animals. Zoos throughout the U.S. are finding ways to help animals beat the heat.

TITLE: The Senate is moving ahead on Democrats' sweeping health, climate and tax bill
SUMMARY: The wide-ranging legislation targets climate change, health care costs and taxes. Majority Leader Chuck Schumer kicked off floor debate on Saturday evening.

TITLE: Opinion: Vin Scully voiced baseball's history
SUMMARY: Vin Scully, the "Voice of the Dodgers," died this week at the age of 94. Scott Simon reflects on the announcer's skill calling games for MLB's Los Angeles team.

TITLE: What a decade of Curiosity has taught us about life on Mars
SUMMARY: Ten years ago today, NASA's Curiosity Mars rover successfully commenced its mission to explore the possibility of life on mars. Here's what it has discovered.

TITLE: Democrats are set to pass a major climate, health and tax bill. Here's what's in it
SUMMARY: Senate Democrats spent the weekend advancing what they call a historic piece of legislation, but it's still a much smaller version of what they — and President Biden — originally called for.

TITLE: Republicans have long feuded with the mainstream media. Now many are shutting them out
SUMMARY: A trend of GOP candidates ignoring or actively avoiding legacy media — particularly national outlets — is building this year.  That can hamper voters' ability to make informed choices.

TITLE: His hometown didn't have a veterans memorial, so this teen built one himself
SUMMARY: For his Eagle Scout project, teenager Dominique Claseman built a veterans memorial in Olivia, Minnesota. With help from his community, he raised more than $77,000 to complete it.

TITLE: Ex-rebel sworn in as Colombia's president in historic shift
SUMMARY: Colombia's first leftist president will be sworn into office Sunday, promising to fight inequality and heralding a turning point in the history of the country.

TITLE: 17 missing, 121 hurt, 1 dead in fire at Cuban oil facility
SUMMARY: A fire set off by a lightning strike at an oil storage facility raged uncontrolled in the Cuban city of Matanzas, where four explosions and flames injured 121 people and left 17 firefighters missing.

TITLE: These Ukrainian volunteers recover soldiers' remains to return them to their families
SUMMARY: Evacuation 200 is a special volunteer unit that scours the country for the bodies of soldiers left on battlefields. "My job is to accompany these heroes on their last trip home," one volunteer says.

TITLE: At least 31 people have been killed in clashes in Gaza since the start of the weekend
SUMMARY: An Israeli offensive launched Friday followed what the government called concrete threats of an imminent attack. Militants have fired hundreds of rockets at Israel in response.

TITLE: President Biden again tests negative for COVID, ends isolation
SUMMARY: The president arrived in Rehoboth Beach, Del., where the first family has a home.

TITLE: After a police officer sent a racist text, a town disbanded its department
SUMMARY: Officials in Vincent, Ala., have fired the police chief and assistant chief. The Shelby County Sheriff's Office said it will provide emergency law enforcement in the meantime.

TITLE: Authors and bookstore owners worry a big publishing merger will affect diversity
SUMMARY: The proposed merger between Penguin Random House and Simon & Schuster will likely change things for authors and readers - for better or worse

TITLE: After a police officer sent a racist text, a town disbanded the entire department
SUMMARY: Officials in Vincent, Ala., have fired the police chief and assistant chief. The Shelby County Sheriff's Office said it will provide emergency law enforcement in the meantime.

TITLE: The killings of 4 Muslim men in Albuquerque may be linked, police say
SUMMARY: Four Muslim men have been shot and killed over a period of nine months in Albuquerque, N.M. Most recently, a man was found dead on Friday after police received a call about a shooting.

TITLE: RAGBRAI: Riding a bike across Iowa isn't for the sane. Sign me up.
SUMMARY: The Des Moines Register's Annual Great Break Ride Across Iowa is about to celebrate 50 years of pie, gravel roads and a community eager to make you forget about your troubles.

TITLE: 'Scream for Me, Africa!': How the continent is reinventing heavy metal music
SUMMARY: Africa's metalheads have a bold vision. We talk to Edward Banchs, author of a new book about Africa's metal scene, and to a heavy metal singer in Botswana known as "Vulture."

TITLE: At least 36 people have been killed in Gaza since the start of the weekend
SUMMARY: An Israeli offensive launched Friday followed what the government called concrete threats of an imminent attack. Militants have fired hundreds of rockets at Israel in response.

TITLE: Anne Heche's hospitalization after a car crash divides social media
SUMMARY: The 53-year-old, who first rose to fame on the soap opera <em>Another World

TITLE: Israel and Palestinian militants agree to a cease-fire in Gaza
SUMMARY: Egyptian officials said both sides agreed to a truce to end a flare-up of violence that has killed dozens of Palestinians.

TITLE: Democrats pass a major climate, health and tax bill. Here's what's in it
SUMMARY: Senate Democrats spent the weekend advancing what they call a historic piece of legislation, but it's still a much smaller version of what they — and President Biden — originally called for.

TITLE: A cease-fire between Israel and Palestinian militants has taken effect in Gaza
SUMMARY: Egyptian officials said both sides agreed to a truce to end a flare-up of violence that has killed dozens of Palestinians.

TITLE: Democrats passed a major climate, health and tax bill. Here's what's in it
SUMMARY: Senate Democrats spent the weekend advancing what they call a historic piece of legislation, but it's still a much smaller version of what they — and President Biden — originally called for.

TITLE: A London museum agrees to return more than 70 pieces of looted Nigerian art
SUMMARY: The Horniman Museum promised to repatriate a trove of artifacts, which include objects known as Benin bronzes, looted from West Africa during a British military invasion in 1897.

TITLE: Hong Kong cuts COVID hotel quarantine to 3 days for arrivals
SUMMARY: Hong Kong's COVID lockdown measures have devastated the city's tourism industry and disrupted business travel in a city known for being an international financial center and a business hub.

TITLE: COVID sewage surveillance labs join the hunt for monkeypox
SUMMARY: Wastewater testing has proved a reliable early alarm bell for COVID-19 outbreaks. U.S. researchers are now adapting the approach to track the explosive spread of monkeypox, and maybe other viruses.

TITLE: An island in the Galápagos reintroduced iguanas after nearly 200 years of extinction
SUMMARY: The Galápagos land iguana is back on Santiago Island. That's thanks to some help from a team of conservationists.

TITLE: Scared after the fall of Roe, these 2 Texas women rushed to tie the knot
SUMMARY: Following the Supreme Court's decision, Carlie Brown and Molly Pela rescheduled their wedding for nine months earlier. They fear that without federal protections, their family remains vulnerable.

TITLE: Poll: Black, Native American and Latino families face serious problems from inflation
SUMMARY: Those households are struggling to stay afloat, according to a new poll from NPR, the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation and the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health.

TITLE: Hamid Karzai stays on in Afghanistan — hoping for the best, but unable to leave
SUMMARY: When the Taliban reclaimed Kabul last August, the U.S.-backed government collapsed and hundreds of thousands of Afghans fled the country. Former president Hamid Karzai was not one of them.

TITLE: Senate delivers a major boost to Biden's agenda
SUMMARY: In a statement issued after the Senate's passed the roughly $700 billion bill, the president said "doing the important thing almost always" requires compromises.

TITLE: Men face sentencing for hate crimes in Ahmaud Arbery's death
SUMMARY: Arbery's killing on Feb. 23, 2020, became part of a larger national reckoning over racial injustice and killings of unarmed Black people.

TITLE: How to talk about disability sensitively and avoid ableist tropes
SUMMARY: When it comes to disability, a lot of ableist language and tropes are perpetuated by the media. Here's what experts have to say about how to talk about disability.

TITLE: New York's mayor says Abbott sending busloads of migrants from Texas is 'horrific'
SUMMARY: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is blasting Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, saying he has used thousands of innocent people as "political pawns."

TITLE: A 'staggering' number of people couldn't get care during the pandemic, poll finds
SUMMARY: Insured or not, one in five said they couldn't get treated for serious illness, while preventive and elective procedures were neglected. Disruptions in care hit Black and Native Americans the hardest.

TITLE: The man who fatally shot Ahmaud Arbery is given another life sentence
SUMMARY: Arbery's killing on Feb. 23, 2020, became part of a larger national reckoning over racial injustice and killings of unarmed Black people.
